title: Certificate Borders
content:
Hi all,

Has anyone come across any resources for Certificate Borders.

The best I found so far was this guy: [http://www.artistmike.com/CertificateDesigns/1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20091023125853/http:/www.artistmike.com/CertificateDesigns/1.html "http://www.artistmike.com/CertificateDesigns/1.html")  
He charges $25 bucks for each border (which isn’t outrageous, but I’d like to find a more affordable, preferably free resource if I could.)

Tutorials would be another great resource.

Border like these are more desirable:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091023125853im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Page48_6451.jpg)
author: Asvetic

comments.content: Thanks Ben. I’ll give that a gander. I wasn’t even thinking Bank Notes or Engraved Patterns as a search query.
I figured there’d be a nice tutorial that shows you how to manipulate the Transform tool to recreate the spirals and stuff, and then show you how to create a seamless pattern brush out of it all.
This isn’t a tutorial, but a lightbox from iStockphoto. [Vector Engravings](http://web.archive.org/web/20091023125853/http:/www.istockphoto.com/file_search.php?action=file&lightboxID=2571277).

What you want is available as the “Certified Borders” series at MyFonts, in which the frame components are broken down into the equivalent of letters in a font alphabet, which makes everything easier to control and compose:

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=certified+borders](http://web.archive.org/web/20091023125853/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=certified+borders "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=certified+borders")
I think those borders are not the same, but useful for other things just the same.
